metadata.feature_description: Core functionality for creating and managing multi-column layouts on pages, including default layout creation and column configuration.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Default 4-Column Layout Display in Edit Mode

steps.action: Navigate to home page and enter Edit Mode
steps.expected: Edit mode controls should appear with module panes visible
steps.actual: Edit mode activated successfully, all panes labeled (F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4) are visible

steps.action: View Content Layout modules with 4-column layout
steps.expected: 4 columns should be displayed with content
steps.actual: 4-column layout displayed correctly with TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS in first module and HOME THEATERS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, CAMERAS in second module

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Column Size Percentages Display on Hover

steps.action: Hover over Content Layout module in Edit Mode
steps.expected: Column size percentages should appear for each column
steps.actual: Column percentages (25%, 25%, 25%, 25%) displayed on hover for each pane

test_scenarios.scenario_name: CSS Classes Generated Correctly for 4-Column Layout

steps.action: Inspect DOM elements to verify Bootstrap CSS classes
steps.expected: Each pane should have responsive Bootstrap grid classes (col-lg-3, col-md-4, col-sm-6, col-xs-12)
steps.actual: All 8 panes (F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4) have correct CSS classes: 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12'

steps.expected: Resize handles (ui-resizable-handle) should exist between columns
steps.actual: Found 6 resize handles (3 for each Content Layout module) with ui-resizable-e class

steps.action: Drag resize handle to change column width
steps.actual: Column sizes changed from 25%/25%/25%/25% to 33%/17%/25%/25% after dragging

steps.expected: API should return list of available layout templates

steps.action: Navigate to page in View Mode (without Edit controls)
steps.expected: Layout should render correctly without edit UI elements
steps.actual: 4-column layout rendered correctly in view mode with all 8 product categories displayed in 2 rows of 4 columns each

steps.action: Verify CSS classes in View Mode
steps.expected: Bootstrap responsive classes should be applied
steps.actual: All panes have correct CSS classes (col-lg-3 col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12) applied in view mode

steps.action: Verify pane naming follows expected pattern
steps.actual: Panes correctly named: F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2, F30A_Pane3, F30A_Pane4 for first module and 9977_Pane1-4 for second module

steps.action: Attempt to discard changes when page state has changed
steps.expected: System should detect conflict and show appropriate error
steps.actual: Error dialog displayed: 'Another user has taken action on the page and its state has been changed. Please, refresh the page to see the current state.'

observations: The Content Layout module uses a unique 4-character prefix (e.g., F30A, 9977) for pane naming to avoid conflicts with other modules
CSS classes are generated based on column sizes matching predefined templates - custom sizes result in dynamically calculated Bootstrap classes
The LayoutEditor.js provides interactive column resizing via jQuery UI resizable functionality
Column size changes are tracked through the version controller for page versioning support
Default layout is '25,25,25' which creates 4 columns of 25% width each
The AreCustomColumnSizes flag determines whether inline width styles are applied (true) or only CSS classes (false)
